proper.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Everything was in its proper place (=where it should be).
the proper way to clean your teeth
The proper name for Matthew’s condition is hyperkinetic syndrome.
proper.translation[0].definitions[1].def: socially or legally correct and acceptable
proper.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: It is only right and proper that an independent inquiry should take place.
I don’t feel that it would be proper for me to give you that information.
it is proper (for somebody) to do something
proper.translation[0].definitions[2].def: real, or of a good and generally accepted standard
proper.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: When are you going to settle down and get a proper job?
Try to eat proper meals instead of fast-food takeaways.
proper.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the real or main part of something, not other parts before, after, or near to it
proper.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The friendly chat which comes before the interview proper is intended to relax the candidate.
proper.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: He’s made a proper fool of himself this time!
proper.translation[0].definitions[5].def: very polite, and careful to do what is socially correct
proper.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: She was very formal and proper.
proper.translation[1].definitions[0].def: used by some people to mean properly, although most people think that this is incorrect
